Title.evidence: A convincing method of concomitantly treating both combined disorders has not been reported.

Participants.evidence: Indications for this technique included subtrochanteric aseptic nonunions, patient younger than 60 years, and 2.0 to 5.0 cm shortening.

Intervention.evidence: treated by femoral condylar skeletal traction, one-stage lengthening to 4 cm maximum, static locked nail stabilization, and corticocancellous bone grafting.

Objective.evidence: A convincing method of concomitantly treating both combined disorders has not been reported.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Twenty-one patients were followed for a minimum of 1.2 years (mean, 3.2 years; range, 1.2–6.7 years).

Result_Outcome.evidence: All nonunions healed with a union rate of 100% (21 of 21) and a median union period of 4.0 months (range, 3.5–11 months).

Harms.evidence: One nonunion healed at 11 months despite nail breakage.
